title: 103_hr2525
content: The Act amends the 1986 Code, with references to sections of the Internal Revenue Code. It also includes a reduction in occupational taxes for distilled spirits, wine, and beer. The Act amends various sections of the Internal Revenue Code to reduce occupational taxes for distilled spirits, wine, and beer. This includes lowering taxes for proprietors of distilled spirits plants, brewers, wholesale dealers, retail dealers, nonbeverage drawback, and industrial use. The amendments made by this section will be effective on July 1, 1994, but will not apply to taxes imposed before that date. Repeal of occupational taxes on distilled spirits, wine, and beer. Repeal of occupational taxes on distilled spirits, wine, and beer, including provisions for proprietors of plants, brewers, wholesale and retail dealers, and general provisions. Amendments made to sections regarding nonbeverage domestic drawback and industrial use of distilled spirits. Repeal of industrial use of distilled spirits under section 5276 and conforming amendments to part II of subchapter A of chapter 51. The text chunk discusses miscellaneous provisions related to manufacturers of stills, nonbeverage domestic drawback claimants, recordkeeping by dealers, and other provisions in subchapter A of chapter 51. The table of parts for subchapter A is amended accordingly. The text chunk discusses the redesignation of subparts and sections within subchapter A of chapter 51, specifically related to manufacturers of stills and nonbeverage domestic drawback claimants. The redesignation of subparts and sections within subchapter A of chapter 51 includes amendments to Section 5111, removing certain elements and adding a new subpart in Part II. The redesignation of subparts and sections within subchapter A of chapter 51 includes amendments to Section 5111, with Section 5114 moved to subpart C as Section 5121 for recordkeeping by wholesale dealers. The new subsection (c) defines wholesale dealers in liquors, including wholesale dealers in liquors, beer, and dealers selling distilled spirits, wines, or beer. The sale of distilled spirits, wines, or beer in quantities of 20 wine gallons or more to the same person at the same time is presumptive evidence of engaging in the business of a wholesale dealer in liquors or beer. This presumption can be rebutted with evidence showing the sale was made to a non-dealer. Section 5124 relating to records is moved to subpart C of part II of subchapter A of chapter 51. Section 5124 is amended by changing the section heading. "Recordkeeping by retail dealers is required under Section 5122." Retail dealers in liquors and beer are defined in the section by the types of alcohol they sell. The term "dealer" is defined as per section 5121(c)(3). Section 5146 is moved to subpart C of part II of subchapter A of chapter 51, redesignated as section 5123. Part II of subchapter A of chapter 51 is amended by inserting a new subpart after subpart C. Subpart D of chapter 51 includes sections on packaging distilled spirits for industrial uses and prohibited purchases by dealers. Section 5116 is moved to subpart D and renamed as section 5131, with amendments related to definitions. A new section 5132 is added, focusing on prohibited purchases by dealers. "Section 5132 prohibits dealers from purchasing distilled spirits from anyone other than a wholesale dealer in liquors who keeps the required records. Penalties and forfeiture may apply." The text discusses amendments to various sections related to penalties and definitions in the context of brewing beer for sale. Section 5182 is amended to exclude individuals producing tax-exempt beer under section 5053(e). Section 5182 is amended to exclude individuals producing tax-exempt beer under section 5053(e). Provisions for recordkeeping by wholesale liquor dealers can be found in section 5112, and by retail liquor dealers in section 5122. Various sections are amended and repealed, with sections 5142, 5143, and 5145 moved to subchapter D of chapter 52. Section 5732(c)(2) is amended to replace "this subpart" with "this subchapter". Section 5732 is further amended to remove references to the tax imposed by section 5131. Subsection (c) of section 5733 is modified by renumbering paragraphs. The table of sections for subchapter D of chapter 52 is updated. Section 5732 is amended by redesignating subsection (d) as subsection (c). Section 6071 is amended by replacing "section 5142" with "section 5732". Section 7652(g) is amended by changing "subpart F" to "subpart B" and "section 5131(a)" to "section 5111(a)". The table of sections for subchapter D of chapter 51 is updated by removing the item relating to section 5276. The item relating to section 5276 is removed. The amendments will be effective on July 1, 1995, and will not apply to taxes before that date.
